entry.title: Canada T4A-NR 2025 Regulatory Changes: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance(DRC)
entry.content:
Towards the end of 2025, the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) rolled out updates to the T4A-NR slip, summary forms, and the T619 XML schema. These changes, which will affect filings due on or before the last day of February 2026, have been seamlessly integrated into SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) solutions, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition /On-Premise. Here’s a detailed look at what these updates entail and how SAP is ensuring compliance.

Key Regulatory Changes

  1. Updated CRA Forms: The CRA has released new 2025 versions of the T4A-NR slip and the T4A-NR Summary (T4A-NR-SUM) for the 2025 tax year. While the content changes are minimal, using the correct form version is essential to avoid filing issues.
  2. T619 XML Schema Updates:
    • Mandatory Language Code: To ensure consistent language identification for CRA communications, the T619 electronic transmittal now requires a language code to specify English or French, denoted by “E” or “F” for every submission. Previously optional, this field is now mandatory for 2025 filings.
    • No Empty Fields in XML: A new validation rule mandates that any optional XML element with no data must be omitted entirely. This means if a data field doesn’t apply or is blank, the system should not generate that XML tag at all, as including empty tags can lead to file rejection by the CRA. 

SAP's Support of Regulatory Changes

As part ofSAP’s end-to-end compliance vision, the SAP Globalization Product Management team has proactively delivered the necessary updates to accommodate these CRA changes, to ensure that customers can generate compliant T4A-NR slips, summaries, and XML files across SAP Cloud ERP solutions:

  • SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: The T4A-NR form and summary Adobe print forms have been updated in the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) and SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud to match the CRA’s 2025 PDF layout. Electronic filing content for T4A-NR has been enhanced to output XML according to the new schema, delivered via the regular quarterly release.
  •  SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition/On-Premise: SAP Note 3691523 – “Canada T4A-NR Withholding Tax Reporting: Legal Changes 2025” was released, along with a support package containing the updated forms and electronic report definitions. Applying this note or support pack will ensure the system produces the correct 2025 forms and XML.

Next Steps 

  • Review and Implement SAP Update: Ensure your SAP S/4HANA system has the 2025 year-end legal change for T4A-NR applied. For SAP S/4HANA On-Premise, apply SAP Note 3691523. For SAP S/4HANA Cloud, confirm you’re on the latest release that includes the T4A-NR changes. Implement these updates before year-end processing.
  • Test Your Reporting: Generate a sample T4A-NR slip, summary, and XML file in a test environment. Verify that the slip and summary display “2025” and the latest form text. Ensure the language element is present and correctly set, and confirm that there are no empty tags in the file.
  • Consult CRA Resources: Refer to the CRA’s official XML specifications page for the updated schema download and guidance for 2025/2026 filings. The CRA’s T4A-NR guide (RC4445) for 2025, updated December 2025, is also a helpful reference. Links to the schema files and CRA documentation are available on the CRA website.

Call to Action

SAP customers and partners can avoid last-minute scrambles and ensure a smooth tax filing season by taking the following actions:

  • Review our published "What's New" SAP Help Portal documentation, apply, and test the delivered SAP changes promptly.
  • Engage your IT or SAP support team to confirm that your system is outputting the new form and schema correctly. Leverage the Regulatory Change Manager for agility in adapting to new legal requirements.
  • Visit the CRA’s XML specification page for the official schema and test your files against it. With proper preparation, you’ll be ready to file your 2025 T4A‑NR returns without issues.

entry.title: Comparison of Rate Routing and Routing in SAP
entry.content:
Overview

In SAP Production Planning (PP), Routing and Rate Routing are both task lists that define manufacturing operations. While they share similarities, they cater to different manufacturing scenarios and differ in time calculation, setup requirements, and application contexts.

Comparison Table


 
 
Parameter
Rate RoutingRouting
Definition
Defines production quantity and fixed duration to establish production rates.Defines a sequence of operations with detailed times for each step.
Primary Use Case
Repetitive manufacturing and flow production.Discrete manufacturing and production orders.
Time Definition
Based on production rate (quantity per time period).Based on setup, processing, and teardown times per operation.
Setup Time
Typically not defined.Defined for each operation.
Manufacturing Type
Repetitive/Flow manufacturing.Discrete manufacturing.
Sequence Types
Standard and parallel sequences only.Standard, parallel, and alternative sequences.
Transaction Codes
CA21 (Create), CA22 (Change), CA23 (Display).CA01 (Create), CA02 (Change), CA03 (Display).
Costing Approach
Period-based costing.Order-based costing.

Key Differences

  • Time Calculation:
    • Rate Routing → Defines production rates (quantity per time).
    • Routing → Defines operation times (time per quantity).
  • Sequence Flexibility:
    • Rate Routing → No alternative sequences (only standard and parallel).
    • Routing → Supports alternative sequences.
  • Manufacturing Philosophy:
    • Rate Routing → Designed for lean, continuous production.
    • Routing → Suited for varied discrete manufacturing scenarios.

When to Use Each

Rate Routing

  • For repetitive manufacturing with continuous production flows.
  • When products are made in large volumes with consistent rates.
  • In flow manufacturing environments with minimal setup changes.
  • When using Product Cost Collectors (PCC) for period-based costing.
  • For assembly backflush scenarios (e.g., transaction MFBF).

Routing

  • For discrete manufacturing with varied lot sizes.
  • When alternative sequences or flexible operations are required.
  • When detailed setup, processing, and teardown times are needed.
  • For order-based production with specific requirements.

Common Misconceptions

  • Interchangeability: While both can be used in repetitive manufacturing, Rate Routing is recommended for REM due to its design for continuous production and backflushing compatibility.
  • Functionality: Rate Routing offers similar functions as Routing but is optimized for rate-based production.
  • Alternative Sequences: The absence of alternative sequences in Rate Routing is intentional, aligning with standardized repetitive processes.

Recommendation

  • Choose Rate Routing for repetitive manufacturing with standardized processes, continuous flows, and period-based costing.
  • Choose Routing for discrete manufacturing requiring operational flexibility, alternative sequences, and detailed time definitions.

Your choice should align with your manufacturing strategy and costing approach.

entry.title: Sharing Custom Function Module ZPOPUP_TO_GET_ONE_VALUE for Simple User Input
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community! 👋

Today I’d like to share a small but useful development I recently created — a reusable function module that displays a popup to collect a single value entered by the user.

The idea was to create a lightweight and generic solution to obtain user input through a popup, similar to some standard dialogs but fully customizable and easy to reuse across different programs and languages.

The function module was implemented in the standard function group SPO3, and I created a custom screen 101 specifically for this purpose. The screen contains a single input field and standard OK/Cancel buttons, providing a very simple user interaction.  Also, to allow the user to select a date using the standard SAP Calendar, I added the search help BU_DATE_CHAR to the input field.

Final Result:

Sample Code:

FUNCTION ZPOPUP_TO_GET_ONE_VALUE.
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"*"Interface local:
*"  EXPORTING
*"     VALUE(ANSWER)
*"     VALUE(VALUE1) TYPE  BAPI2017_GM_HEAD_01-PSTNG_DATE
*"  EXCEPTIONS
*"      TITEL_TOO_LONG
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------

  ANSWER = 'J'.

  IF sy-langu = 'P'.
    MOVE 'Confirmação' TO GL_TITEL.
  ELSEIF sy-langu = 'E'.
    MOVE 'Confirmation' TO GL_TITEL.
  ELSEIF sy-langu = 'D'.
    MOVE 'Bestätigung' TO GL_TITEL.
  ELSEIF sy-langu = 'S'.
    MOVE 'Confirmación' TO GL_TITEL.
  ELSEIF sy-langu = 'F'.
    MOVE 'Confirmation' TO GL_TITEL.
  ENDIF.

  CLEAR SPOP-VARVALUE1.

  CALL SCREEN 101 STARTING AT 25  6
                  ENDING   AT 90 8.

  VALUE1 = SPOP-VARVALUE1.
  ANSWER = ANTWORT.

ENDFUNCTION.

This small development provides a straightforward method to collect a single user input without repeatedly building a full dynpro from scratch. If you have suggestions for improvements or alternative approaches, I’d be happy to hear your thoughts!

entry.title: Custom Development: Program for Mass Creation of Purchase Requisitions
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community! 👋

Today I’d like to share a custom ABAP Development that I created to simplify and automate a very common operational need: the mass creation of Purchase Requisitions (PRs).

In many organizations, users frequently need to create large volumes of PRs based on spreadsheets, external data, or recurring patterns. Doing this manually through ME51N can be time-consuming, error-prone, and inefficient.

To address this, I developed a standalone program that reads structured input data and automatically creates PRs in bulk, providing clear logs and validation checks.

Report ZMM_LOG_PG03:

REPORT zmm_log_pg03.

INCLUDE:
  zmm_log_pg03_top,
  zmm_log_pg03_lcl,
  zmm_log_pg03_scr,
  zmm_log_pg03_f01.

Include ZMM_LOG_PG03_TOP:

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Include          ZMM_LOG_PG01_TOP
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*


TYPES:
  BEGIN OF gtyp_post.
    INCLUDE TYPE zmm_log_st03.
TYPES:
    bsart TYPE bbsrt,
    knttp TYPE knttp,
    ernam TYPE ernam,
    kostl TYPE kostl,
    ekorg TYPE ekorg,
    ekgrp TYPE ekgrp,
  END OF gtyp_post,
  BEGIN OF gtyp_imp_exp,
    matnr	TYPE matnr,
    menge	TYPE char16,
    werks	TYPE werks_d,
    lgort	TYPE lgort_d,
    lfdat	TYPE char10,

  END OF gtyp_imp_exp,
  BEGIN OF gtyp_imp_exp_ini,
    matnr	TYPE string,
    menge	TYPE string,
    werks	TYPE string,
    lgort	TYPE string,
    lfdat	TYPE string,
    flief	TYPE string,
  END OF gtyp_imp_exp_ini,
  BEGIN OF gtyp_num_errors,
    index TYPE sytabix,
    value TYPE char20,
  END OF gtyp_num_errors,
  BEGIN OF gtyp_date_errors,
    index TYPE sytabix,
    value TYPE char20,
  END OF gtyp_date_errors.


CONSTANTS:
  gc_matkl TYPE rvari_vnam VALUE 'ZMMPURREQ_MATGROUP'.

CLASS: lcl_eventhandler DEFINITION DEFERRED.

DATA:
  BEGIN: OF gt_excl OCCURS 0,
    code TYPE syst_ucomm,
  END OF gt_excl.

DATA:
  gt_out             TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmm_log_st03,
  gt_out_ini         TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmm_log_st03,
  gs_out             TYPE zmm_log_st03,
  gt_post            TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF gtyp_post,
  gs_post            TYPE gtyp_post,
  gt_import          TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF gtyp_imp_exp,
  gt_num_errors      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF gtyp_num_errors WITH KEY index,
  gs_num_errors      TYPE gtyp_num_errors,
  gt_date_errors     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF gtyp_date_errors WITH KEY index,
  gs_date_errors     TYPE gtyp_date_errors,
  gt_protocol_import TYPE lvc_t_msg1,
  gt_rows            TYPE lvc_t_row,
  gs_rows            TYPE lvc_s_row,
  gr_matkl           TYPE RANGE OF matkl,
  gs_matkl           LIKE LINE OF gr_matkl,
  go_container       TYPE REF TO cl_gui_custom_container,
  go_alv             TYPE REF TO cl_gui_alv_grid,
  go_events          TYPE REF TO lcl_eventhandler,
  gv_answer          TYPE char1,
  gv_import          TYPE xfeld,
  gv_progress        TYPE xfeld,
  gv_errors          TYPE xfeld,
  gv_rows            TYPE int4,
  gv_selall          TYPE xfeld.

Include ZMM_LOG_PG03_LCL:

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Include          ZMM_LOG_PG01_LCL
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*

CLASS lcl_eventhandler DEFINITION.

  PUBLIC SECTION.

    CLASS-METHODS:

      handle_data_changed FOR EVENT data_changed OF cl_gui_alv_grid
        IMPORTING
          er_data_changed.


ENDCLASS.                    "lcl_eventhandler DEFINITION

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       CLASS lcl_eventhandler IMPLEMENTATION
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
CLASS lcl_eventhandler IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD handle_data_changed.

    CONSTANTS:
      lv_tabname TYPE tabname VALUE 'ZMM_LOG_ST03'.

    FIELD-SYMBOLS:
      <lfs_value>         TYPE any,
      <lfs_value_o>       TYPE any,
      <lv_value_ref>      TYPE any,
      <lfs_ls_add_fields> TYPE dcfielddat.

    DATA:
      lo_data_changed    TYPE REF TO cl_alv_changed_data_protocol,
      lo_struct          TYPE REF TO cl_abap_structdescr,
      lr_data            TYPE REF TO data,
      lt_comp            TYPE abap_component_tab,
      ls_comp            TYPE abap_componentdescr,
      ls_protocol_import TYPE lvc_s_msg1,
      lt_failure         TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ddfkeyrc,
      ls_failure         TYPE ddfkeyrc,
      lt_add_fields      TYPE dcfielddats,
      ls_good_cell       TYPE lvc_s_modi,
      ls_mod_cell        TYPE lvc_s_modi,
      ls_mod_cell2       TYPE lvc_s_modi,
      ls_mod_cell_add    TYPE lvc_s_modi,
      lv_value           TYPE lvc_value,
      lv_value_o         TYPE lvc_value,
      ls_out             TYPE zmm_log_st03,
      lv_row_id          TYPE int4,
      lv_fieldn	         TYPE lvc_fname,
      lv_fieldname       TYPE fnam_____4,
      ls_syst            TYPE syst,
      lv_msgno           TYPE symsgno,
      lv_msgv1           TYPE char120,
      lv_msgv2           TYPE char120,
      lv_msgv3           TYPE char120,
      lv_proc_f          TYPE f,
      lv_proc            TYPE sy-tabix,
      lv_werks           TYPE werks_d,
      lv_lgort           TYPE lgort_d,
      lv_matnr           TYPE matnr,
      lv_mmsta           TYPE mmsta,
      lv_lifnr           TYPE lifnr,
      lv_datbi           TYPE datbi,
      lv_lines           TYPE i,
      lv_date_format(15) TYPE c.


    IF er_data_changed IS NOT BOUND.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.

    IF gv_import IS NOT INITIAL.

      FREE: er_data_changed->mt_mod_cells.

      lo_struct ?= cl_abap_typedescr=>describe_by_data( ls_out ).
      lt_comp = lo_struct->get_components( ).

      LOOP AT gt_out INTO ls_out.
        lv_row_id = sy-tabix.
        LOOP AT lt_comp INTO ls_comp.
          lv_fieldn = ls_comp-name.
          ASSIGN COMPONENT lv_fieldn OF STRUCTURE ls_out TO <lfs_value_o>.
          IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL AND <lfs_value_o> IS ASSIGNED.
            er_data_changed->modify_cell(
              i_row_id    = lv_row_id
              i_tabix     = lv_row_id
              i_fieldname = lv_fieldn
              i_value     = <lfs_value_o>
            ).
            UNASSIGN <lfs_value_o>.
          ENDIF.
        ENDLOOP.
      ENDLOOP.

      gt_protocol_import = er_data_changed->mt_protocol.

    ELSE.

      LOOP AT er_data_changed->mt_mod_cells INTO ls_mod_cell.
        DELETE gt_protocol_import WHERE row_id = ls_mod_cell-row_id AND fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname.
      ENDLOOP.
      FREE: er_data_changed->mt_protocol.
      CALL METHOD er_data_changed->refresh_protocol.
      LOOP AT gt_protocol_import INTO ls_protocol_import.
        CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
          EXPORTING
            i_msgid     = ls_protocol_import-msgid
            i_msgty     = ls_protocol_import-msgty
            i_msgno     = ls_protocol_import-msgno
            i_msgv1     = ls_protocol_import-msgv1
            i_msgv2     = ls_protocol_import-msgv2
            i_msgv3     = ls_protocol_import-msgv3
            i_msgv4     = ls_protocol_import-msgv4
            i_fieldname = ls_protocol_import-fieldname
            i_row_id    = ls_protocol_import-row_id.
      ENDLOOP.


    ENDIF.


    DESCRIBE TABLE er_data_changed->mt_mod_cells LINES lv_lines.

    LOOP AT er_data_changed->mt_mod_cells INTO ls_mod_cell.

      READ TABLE gt_out INTO ls_out INDEX  ls_mod_cell-row_id.

      lv_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname.
      IF gv_import IS NOT INITIAL.
        ASSIGN COMPONENT lv_fieldname OF STRUCTURE ls_out TO <lfs_value_o>.
        lv_value_o = <lfs_value_o>.

* EXT_DMSF (23/09/2025) - START

        lv_msgv2 = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
        SHIFT lv_msgv2 LEFT DELETING LEADING space.

        IF lv_value_o = '' AND lv_fieldname = 'MATNR'.
          CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
          EXPORTING
            i_msgid     = 'ZMM'
            i_msgty     = 'E'
            i_msgno     = '197'
            i_msgv1     = lv_msgv2
            i_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname
            i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
        ELSEIF lv_fieldname = 'MENGE'.
          SHIFT lv_value_o LEFT DELETING LEADING space.
          IF lv_value_o = '' OR lv_value_o = '0.000'.
          CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
          EXPORTING
            i_msgid     = 'ZMM'
            i_msgty     = 'E'
            i_msgno     = '198'
            i_msgv1     = lv_msgv2
            i_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname
            i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
          ENDIF.
        ELSEIF lv_value_o = '' AND lv_fieldname = 'WERKS'.
          CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
          EXPORTING
            i_msgid     = 'ZMM'
            i_msgty     = 'E'
            i_msgno     = '199'
            i_msgv1     = lv_msgv2
            i_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname
            i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
        ELSEIF lv_value_o = '' AND lv_fieldname = 'LGORT'.
          CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
          EXPORTING
            i_msgid     = 'ZMM'
            i_msgty     = 'E'
            i_msgno     = '200'
            i_msgv1     = lv_msgv2
            i_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname
            i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
        ELSEIF lv_value_o = '' AND lv_fieldname = 'LFDAT'.
          CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
          EXPORTING
            i_msgid     = 'ZMM'
            i_msgty     = 'E'
            i_msgno     = '201'
            i_msgv1     = lv_msgv2
            i_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname
            i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
        ELSEIF lv_value_o = '' AND lv_fieldname = 'FLIEF'.
          CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
          EXPORTING
            i_msgid     = 'ZMM'
            i_msgty     = 'E'
            i_msgno     = '202'
            i_msgv1     = lv_msgv2
            i_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname
            i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
        ENDIF.

* END

      ELSE.
        lv_value_o = ls_mod_cell-value.
      ENDIF.

      FREE: gs_post.
      READ TABLE gt_post INTO gs_post INDEX ls_mod_cell-row_id.


      CASE ls_mod_cell-fieldname.
        WHEN 'MATNR' OR 'WERKS' OR 'LGORT'.
          FREE: lt_failure, lt_add_fields.
          IF ls_mod_cell-fieldname = 'MATNR'.
            CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_MATN1_INPUT'
              EXPORTING
                input         = lv_value_o
              IMPORTING
                output        = lv_value_o.
          ENDIF.
          CALL FUNCTION 'DDUT_INPUT_CHECK'
            EXPORTING
              tabname           = lv_tabname
              fieldname         = lv_fieldname
              value             = lv_value_o
            TABLES
              failure_tab       = lt_failure
            CHANGING
              additional_fields = lt_add_fields
            EXCEPTIONS
              no_ddic_field     = 1
              illegal_move      = 2
              OTHERS            = 3.
          IF lt_add_fields IS NOT INITIAL.
            LOOP AT lt_add_fields ASSIGNING <lfs_ls_add_fields>.
              ASSIGN COMPONENT <lfs_ls_add_fields>-fieldname OF STRUCTURE ls_out TO <lfs_value>.
              IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL AND <lfs_value> IS ASSIGNED.
                ASSIGN <lfs_ls_add_fields>-value->* TO <lv_value_ref>.
                IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL AND <lv_value_ref> IS ASSIGNED.
                  ASSIGN <lfs_ls_add_fields>-value->* TO <lv_value_ref>.
                  <lv_value_ref> =  <lfs_value>.
                  <lfs_ls_add_fields>-found =  abap_true.
                  UNASSIGN <lv_value_ref>.
                ENDIF.
                UNASSIGN <lfs_value>.
              ENDIF.
            ENDLOOP.
            REFRESH: lt_failure.
            CALL FUNCTION 'DDUT_INPUT_CHECK'
              EXPORTING
                tabname           = lv_tabname
                fieldname         = lv_fieldname
                value             = lv_value_o
              TABLES
                failure_tab       = lt_failure
              CHANGING
                additional_fields = lt_add_fields
              EXCEPTIONS
                no_ddic_field     = 1
                illegal_move      = 2
                OTHERS            = 3.
          ENDIF.
          IF lt_failure IS NOT INITIAL.
            LOOP AT lt_failure INTO ls_failure.
              ls_failure-arbgb = 'ZMM'.
              lv_msgno = ls_failure-msgnr.
              IF ls_mod_cell-fieldname = 'WERKS'.
                lv_msgno = 184.
                ls_failure-msgv2 = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
                SHIFT ls_failure-msgv2 LEFT DELETING LEADING space.
              ELSEIF ls_mod_cell-fieldname = 'LGORT'.
                lv_msgno = 185.
                ls_failure-msgv1 = ls_out-lgort.
                ls_failure-msgv2 = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
                SHIFT ls_failure-msgv2 LEFT DELETING LEADING space.
                ls_failure-msgv3 = ls_out-werks.
              ELSEIF ls_mod_cell-fieldname = 'MATNR'.
                lv_msgno = 181.
                ls_failure-msgv2 = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
                SHIFT ls_failure-msgv2 LEFT DELETING LEADING space.
                ls_failure-msgv3 = lv_werks.
                ls_failure-msgv4 = ls_out-lgort.
              ENDIF.
              CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
                EXPORTING
                  i_msgid     = ls_failure-arbgb
                  i_msgty     = ls_failure-msgty
                  i_msgno     = lv_msgno
                  i_msgv1     = ls_failure-msgv1
                  i_msgv2     = ls_failure-msgv2
                  i_msgv3     = ls_failure-msgv3
                  i_msgv4     = ls_failure-msgv4
                  i_fieldname = ls_failure-fieldname
                  i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
            ENDLOOP.
          ELSE.
            IF ls_mod_cell-fieldname = 'MATNR'.

              SELECT SINGLE matnr
                  FROM mara
                 WHERE matnr = @LV_value_o
                  INTO @LV_matnr.
              IF sy-subrc IS NOT INITIAL.
                lv_msgv2 = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
                SHIFT lv_msgv2 LEFT DELETING LEADING space.
                CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
                  EXPORTING
                    i_msgid     = 'ZMM'
                    i_msgty     = 'E'
                    i_msgno     = 179
                    i_msgv1     = lv_value_o
                    i_msgv2     = lv_msgv2
                    i_msgv3     = lv_werks
                    i_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname
                    i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
              ENDIF.

              SELECT SINGLE matnr
                  FROM mara
                 WHERE matnr = @LV_value_o
                   AND matkl IN @GR_matkl
                  INTO @LV_matnr.
              IF sy-subrc IS NOT INITIAL.
                lv_msgv2 = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
                READ TABLE gr_matkl INTO gs_matkl INDEX 1.
                IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
                  lv_msgv3 = gs_matkl-low.
                ENDIF.
                SHIFT lv_msgv2 LEFT DELETING LEADING space.
                CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
                  EXPORTING
                    i_msgid     = 'ZMM'
                    i_msgty     = 'E'
                    i_msgno     = 180
                    i_msgv1     = lv_value_o
                    i_msgv2     = lv_msgv2
                    i_msgv3     = lv_msgv3
                    i_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname
                    i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
              ENDIF.

              lv_werks = ls_out-werks.
              IF lv_value_o IS NOT INITIAL AND lv_werks IS NOT INITIAL.
                SELECT SINGLE mmsta
                  FROM marc
                 WHERE matnr = @LV_value_o
                   AND werks = @LV_werks
                   AND mmsta IS INITIAL
                  INTO @LV_mmsta.
                IF sy-subrc IS NOT INITIAL.
                  lv_msgv2 = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
                  SHIFT lv_msgv2 LEFT DELETING LEADING space.
                  CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
                    EXPORTING
                      i_msgid     = 'ZMM'
                      i_msgty     = 'E'
                      i_msgno     = 182
                      i_msgv1     = lv_value_o
                      i_msgv2     = lv_msgv2
                      i_msgv3     = lv_werks
                      i_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname
                      i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
                ENDIF.
              ENDIF.
            ENDIF.

          ENDIF.


          IF ls_mod_cell-fieldname = 'MATNR'.
            FREE: lv_value.
            SELECT SINGLE maktx
              INTO lv_value
              FROM makt
             WHERE matnr = lv_value_o
               AND spras = sy-langu.
            er_data_changed->modify_cell(
              i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id
              i_fieldname = 'MAKTX'
              i_value     = lv_value
            ).


            IF gs_post-bsart IS INITIAL.
              CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
                EXPORTING
                  i_msgid     = 'ZMM'
                  i_msgty     = 'E'
                  i_msgno     = 188
                  i_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname
                  i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
            ENDIF.

            IF gs_post-knttp IS INITIAL.
              CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
                EXPORTING
                  i_msgid     = 'ZMM'
                  i_msgty     = 'E'
                  i_msgno     = 189
                  i_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname
                  i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
            ENDIF.

            IF gs_post-ekorg IS INITIAL OR gs_post-ekgrp IS INITIAL.
              CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
                EXPORTING
                  i_msgid     = 'ZMM'
                  i_msgty     = 'E'
                  i_msgno     = 191
                  i_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname
                  i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
            ENDIF.


*                bsart TYPE bbsrt,
*    knttp TYPE knttp,
*    ernam TYPE ernam,
*    kostl TYPE kostl,
*    ekorg TYPE ekorg,
*    ekgrp TYPE ekgrp,
          ENDIF.


        WHEN 'LFDAT'.
          READ TABLE gt_date_errors WITH KEY index = ls_mod_cell-row_id
                                    TRANSPORTING NO FIELDS.
          IF sy-subrc IS NOT INITIAL.
*            IF ls_mod_cell-value <> sy-datum.
            IF lv_value_o <> sy-datum. " EXT_DMSF (26/09/2025)
              WRITE ls_mod_cell-row_id TO lv_msgv1 LEFT-JUSTIFIED.
              CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
                EXPORTING
                  i_msgid     = 'ZMM'
                  i_msgty     = 'W'
                  i_msgno     = 192
                  i_msgv1     = lv_msgv1
                  i_fieldname = ls_mod_cell-fieldname
                  i_row_id    = ls_mod_cell-row_id.
            ENDIF.
          ENDIF.

        WHEN 'FLIEF'.
          UNPACK lv_value_o TO lv_lifnr.
          SELECT SINGLE lifnr
            INTO lv_lifnr
            FROM lfm1
           WHERE lifnr = lv_lifnr
             AND ekorg = gs_post-ekorg.
          IF sy-subrc IS NOT INITIAL.
            lv_msgv2 = gs_post-ekorg.
            CALL METHOD er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry
              EXPORTING

      cntl_error              = 2
      error_no_gui            = 3
      not_supported_by_gui    = 4
      OTHERS                  = 5.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    FREE: lt_filetable.
  ENDIF.



  IF lt_filetable IS NOT INITIAL.
    READ TABLE lt_filetable INTO ls_filetable INDEX 1.

      EXPORTING

        gui_refuse_filetransfer = 4
        invalid_type            = 5
        no_authority            = 6
        unknown_error           = 7
        bad_data_format         = 8
        header_not_allowed      = 9
        separator_not_allowed   = 10
        header_too_long         = 11
        unknown_dp_error        = 12
        access_denied           = 13
        dp_out_of_memory        = 14
        disk_full               = 15
        dp_timeout              = 16
        OTHERS                  = 17.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.


    FREE: lt_import.

      FREE: ls_import, ls_import_ini.
      IF sy-tabix = 1.
        CONTINUE.
      ENDIF.
      lv_tabix = sy-tabix - 1.
      SPLIT ls_csv AT ';' INTO ls_import_ini-matnr ls_import_ini-menge ls_import_ini-werks
                               ls_import_ini-lgort ls_import_ini-lfdat ls_import_ini-flief.

      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-matnr ) > 18.

      ELSE.

      ENDIF.
      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-werks ) > 4.
        ls_import-werks = ls_import_ini-werks(4).
      ELSE.
        ls_import-werks = ls_import_ini-werks.
      ENDIF.

      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-flief ) > 10.
        ls_import-flief = ls_import_ini-flief(10).
      ELSE.
        ls_import-flief = ls_import_ini-flief.
      ENDIF.
      TRANSLATE ls_import-menge  USING ',.'.
      IF zcl_mm_generic=>check_numeric( ls_import-menge ) IS NOT INITIAL.
        FREE: gs_num_errors.
        gs_num_errors-index = lv_tabix.
        gs_num_errors-value = ls_import_ini-menge.

      IF ls_import_ini-lfdat IS INITIAL.

          EXPORTING
            date_external            = ls_import_ini-lfdat

            date_internal            = ls_import-lfdat
          EXCEPTIONS
            date_external_is_invalid = 1

        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
          FREE: ls_import-lfdat.
          FREE: gs_date_errors, ls_import-lfdat.
          gs_date_errors-index = lv_tabix.
          gs_date_errors-value = ls_import_ini-lfdat.
          APPEND gs_date_errors TO gt_date_errors.
        ENDIF.
      ELSE.
        FREE: ls_import-lfdat.
        FREE: gs_date_errors, ls_import-lfdat.
        gs_date_errors-index = lv_tabix.
        gs_date_errors-value = ls_import_ini-lfdat.
        APPEND gs_date_errors TO gt_date_errors.
      ENDIF.
      APPEND ls_import TO lt_import.
    ENDLOOP.


    FREE: gt_out.
    CALL METHOD go_alv->refresh_table_display.

    gt_out = CORRESPONDING #( lt_import ).
    gt_out_ini = gt_out.

    CALL FUNCTION 'VIEW_GET_DATA'
      EXPORTING
        view_name              = 'V_T001K_ASSIGN'
      TABLES
        data                   = lt_assign
      EXCEPTIONS
        no_viewmaint_tool      = 1
        no_authority           = 2
        no_auth_for_sel        = 3
        data_access_restricted = 4
        no_functiongroup       = 5
        OTHERS                 = 6.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      FREE: lt_assign.
    ENDIF.

    SELECT * FROM zmm_ariba_ta_01 INTO TABLE lt_ta_01 WHERE action = '01'.
    SELECT * FROM zmm_ariba_ta_03 INTO TABLE lt_ta_03.
    SELECT * FROM zmm_ariba_ta_12 INTO TABLE lt_ta_12.
    SELECT * FROM zmm_consumos    INTO TABLE lt_consumos.

    IF gt_out IS NOT INITIAL.
      LOOP AT gt_out ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_out>).
        CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_MATN1_INPUT'
              EXPORTING
                input         = <ls_out>-matnr
              IMPORTING
                output        = <ls_out>-matnr.
      ENDLOOP.

      SELECT matnr matkl prdha
        INTO TABLE lt_matkl_prdha
        FROM mara
         FOR ALL ENTRIES IN gt_out
       WHERE matnr = gt_out-matnr.
    ENDIF.

    FREE: gt_post.
    LOOP AT gt_out INTO gs_out.
      MOVE-CORRESPONDING gs_out TO gs_post.
      gs_post-ernam = sy-uname.
      READ TABLE lt_assign WITH KEY werks = gs_post-werks
                           INTO ls_assign .
      IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
        READ TABLE lt_ta_01 WITH TABLE KEY bukrs = ls_assign-bukrs
                            INTO ls_ta_01.
        IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
          gs_post-bsart = ls_ta_01-bbsrt.

                                    INTO ls_matkl_prdha.

                                         werks = gs_post-werks
                                         prodh = ls_matkl_prdha-prdha
                                INTO ls_ta_12.

            ELSE.
              READ TABLE lt_ta_12 WITH KEY bukrs = ls_assign-bukrs
                                         prodh = ls_matkl_prdha-prdha
                                INTO ls_ta_12.
              IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
                gs_post-knttp = ls_ta_12-knttp.
              ENDIF.
            ENDIF.
            IF gs_post-knttp = 'K'.
              READ TABLE lt_consumos WITH KEY werks = gs_post-werks
                                              lgort = gs_post-lgort
                                     INTO ls_consumos.
              IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
                gs_post-kostl = ls_consumos-kostl_c.
              ENDIF.
              CLEAR gs_post-ekorg. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/02025)
              LOOP AT lt_ta_03 INTO ls_ta_03 WHERE werks = gs_post-werks
                                               AND lgort = gs_post-lgort
                                               AND low_id_cat <= ls_matkl_prdha-matkl
